lead_paragraph: A nonprofit group that handed out the Butkus Award to the nation’s top linebacker will stop presenting it after a yearlong legal battle with Dick Butkus. He sued in Los Angeles federal court in 2007, demanding the Downtown Athletic Club of Orlando relinquish control of the award, which it had given out for 23 years and trademarked in 1987. He said the club did not raise enough money for charity and in April won a summary judgment. Butkus’s family will begin presenting the award in January in Chicago, where he grew up and played eight Pro Bowl seasons for the Bears.
